content: Hi, I'm wondering why this advisory isn't on the website: https://github.com/RustSec/advisory-db/blob/master/crates/sized-chunks/RUSTSEC-2020-0041.toml

Do you mean rust-lang.org?
(Does rust-lang.org even had a rustsec section?)

My guess is because it's a third party library unassociated with the rust "project" itself. And displaying a warning there for every broken third party library seems a bad idea I think.

Or do you mean https://crates.io/crates/sized-chunks in which case I guess it's a missing feature to display rustsec entries on the crates entry page. A feature which would be really nice to have I think ;=)
It does not show up on https://rustsec.org/advisories/ either
Some other don't show up either like the one for crayon.
The website seems to not have been rebuild since 2020-08-25. (Edit: sorry writing from my phone).
@Alexander Kjäll you can ask in #wg-secure-code they handle advisories :smile:
(my last comment was wrt. that side after jonas pointed it out, it seems that the side has not been updated for roughly half a month)
